thread.title: Tara Brown murder: Bandido bikie Lionel Patea pleads guilty to bashing mum to death on Gold Coast
thread.title_full: Tara Brown murder: Bandido bikie Lionel Patea pleads guilty to bashing mum to death on Gold Coast

author: Alexandria Utting and Tanya Westthorp
title: Tara Brown murder: Bandido bikie Lionel Patea pleads guilty to bashing mum to death on Gold Coast
text:
TRIPLE 0 operators listened helplessly as young mum Tara Brown was brutally murdered at the side of the road by her bikie ex, a Brisbane Supreme Court has been told. 
Former Bandido sergeant-at-arms Lionel Patea today pleaded guilty to the murder as shocking details of Ms Brown’s final moments emerged.
Witnesses at first thought Patea was trying to rescue Ms Brown, 24, after he rammed her car and ran it off the road, helping him reach her before he started brutally bashing her.
They then tried to stop him but Patea, 25, fought them off.
Before being rammed, a terrified Ms Brown had called Triple 0 and could be heard screaming for help as she was chased and rammed by a pursuing Patea in a black Jeep on the Gold Coast on the morning of September 8, 2015.
The prosecution told the court she was screaming ‘he’s going to stab me’ on the recorded call before a crashing sound could be heard when Ms Brown’s car was struck from behind by Patea and plunged down an embankment.
BIKIES SUSPECTED IN AIRPORT WEST DRIVE-BY SHOOTING 
Tweets by Tanya_Westthorp 
Sixteen thumping sounds could be heard and then another 13 more as Patea smashed Ms Brown’s face with a 7.8kg fire hydrant metal plate, the court was told.
Moaning and ‘Lionel stop’ could be heard and Ms Brown kicked out her legs as she was beaten.
She was silent during the final two blows and was rushed to Gold Coast University Hospital where she had ‘non-survivable’ head injuries including multiple facial fractures and a laceration directly on her brain.
DECISION ON DUSTIN MARTIN’S DAD, DEPORTED OVER BIKIE TIES 
Lionel Patea has pleaded guilty to killing his ex-girlfriend and mother of his child, Tara Brown. Photo: Instagram Source: Supplied 
Tara Brown. Photo: Instagram Source: Supplied 
Lionel Patea and Tara Brown in happier times. Photo: Instagram Source: Supplied 
Patea had been due to stand trial in the Brisbane Supreme Court today over the public murder which shocked Australia almost two years ago.
Ms Brown had dropped the pair’s daughter Aria at childcare prior to being followed and killed by Patea.
The horror scene after Tara Brown was rammed off the road — firefighters cut her from the wreck. Picture by Scott Fletcher Source: News Corp Australia 
After the attack, Patea stole a Gold Coast City Council ute that was parked nearby and drove off.
He turned himself into Coomera Police Station with several self-inflicted stab wounds and a collapsed lung and asked to be locked up, about an hour after the incident.
Tara’s distraught mum Natalie Brown hugs and comforts Tara's daughter Aria at her funeral. Picture: Glenn Hampson Source: Supplied 
He was originally charged with attempted murder but the charges were upgraded to murder after Ms Brown died.
Patea also pleaded guilty to dangerous operation of a motor vehicle in relation to the incidents that occurred on the morning of September 8, 2015.

1 of 18 HIDE THUMBS Patea has been on remand at Brisbane’s Arthur Gorrie prison at Wacol since being charged with Ms Brown’s murder.
He has been kept in the prison’s detention centre for much of his stay due to long-running battles with prison guards and concerns over his safety in the jail.
In November last year, he pleaded guilty to a hot water attack on another prisoner and was sentenced to a further 18 months behind bars.
Tara Brown was rushed to hospital after being freed from the wreck but died from her injuries. Picture by Scott Fletcher Source: News Corp Australia 
Lionel Patea and Tara Brown were high school sweethearts but it ended in a deadly rampage. Photo: Instagram Source: Supplied 
Tara Brown with daughter Aria. Photo: Instagram Source: Supplied 
Originally published as Bikie admits to horror roadside slaying
